Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
invariant
<programming> A rule, such as the {ordering} of an ordered list or {heap}, that applies throughout the life of a data structure or procedure. Each change to the data structure must maintain the correctness of the invariant.
(1996-03-12)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Invariant \In*va"ri*ant\, n. (Math.) An invariable quantity; specifically, a function of the coefficients of one or more forms, which remains unaltered, when these undergo suitable linear transformations. --J. J. Sylvester. [1913 Webster]
